An application will supply an implementation of the @B_android#support#v17#leanback#app#SearchFragment#SearchResultProvider_E@ interface to handle the search and return an @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ObjectAdapter_E@ containing the results. A SpeechRecognizer object will be created for which your application will need to declare android.permission.RECORD_AUDIO in AndroidManifest file. If app's target version is >= 23 and the device version is >= 23, a permission dialog will show first time using speech recognition. 0 will be used as requestCode in requestPermissions() call. @B_android#support#v17#leanback#app#SearchFragment#setSpeechRecognitionCallback_E@ is deprecated. Speech recognition is automatically started when fragment is created, but not when fragment is restored from an instance state. Activity may manually call @B_android#support#v17#leanback#app#SearchFragment#startRecognition_E@, typically in onNewIntent().
